description.narrative: Australia’s bilateral development assistance to China will conclude in 2013. Based on shared goals to reduce regional and global poverty, and address issues of mutual interest in the region, Australia and China are advancing the new development partnership through: negotiating a new Development Partnership MOU; establishing Development Working Groups (DWG) under the existing framework of the Joint Ministerial Economic Commission; and collaborating on areas such as health and water resources management in the Asia Pacific region to help reduce poverty in the region and address key regional development issues. Australia and China have agreed to undertake joint work on irrigation in Cambodia. The Cambodia-China-Australia Irrigation Project (CCAIP) will add value to the existing strengths and experience of Cambodian state and non-state organisations, and complement the work of other international development partners working in the sector. The total value of this initiative is $0.5 milli
